1.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a year (as a revolution of time)
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
the new moon; by implication, a month
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to

2.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
properly, heed; by implication, purpose (sake or account); used adverbially to indicate the reason or cause
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
something swinging, i.e. the valve of adoor
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
near, with or among; often in general, to
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
to parch (through drought) i.e. (by analogy,) to desolate, destroy, kill

properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

something rolled, i.e. a heap of stone or dung (plural ruins), by analogy, a spring of water (plural waves)

to pull down or in pieces, break, destroy
